DEIE Dispositif d’Echange d’Informations d’Exploitation En tant que gestionnaire du réseau français, Enedis (ex-ERDF) impose l’installation d’un Dispositif d’Échange d’Informations d’Exploitation (DEIE) en France métropolitaine et dans les Zones non interconnectées (ZNI) pour la communication entre le poste de conduite et de surveillance des opérateurs et les centrales solaires à injections. Le DEIE permet l’automatisation de la transmission des informations concernant l’état de fonctionnement de l’installation et du réseau HTA, ainsi que des demandes d’action de découplage sur la centrale. La régulation du tan phi au niveau du Poste de Livraison (PDL) conformément aux spécifications techniques du contrat CARD-I signé entre le producteur et Enedis. Assurez la conformité de votre centrale électrique française en respectant les exigences d’Enedis. Le ePowerControl PPC DEIE d’Elum est un contrôleur de régulation d’injection intégrant les contraintes du code de réseau français pour les centrales solaires en injection réseau. Celle-ci inclut les différents modes : La solution clef-en-main permet de réduire le temps et les coûts de mise en service et offre aux équipes d’ingénierie davantage d’options de compatibilité pendant les phases de conception, d’ingénierie du projet et de mise en service par un accompagnement sur les tests de conformité DEIE ePowerControl PPC pilote la centrale solaire selon les exigences du gestionnaire et du code réseau Français (intégration DEIE, régulation tan Phi selon CARD-I) ePowerControl PPC applique les consignes du gestionnaire réseau / de l’agrégateur et communique l’état de la centrale à chaque instant. Collecte et stockage local sécurisé de toutes les données et alarmes des équipements connectés. Durée de conservation configurable depuis l’interface. L’interface de configuration utilisateur de ePowerControl PPC GI, accessible via n’importe quel navigateur web local (LAN), permet une connectivité autonome des installations et la configuration des équipements lors de la mise en service. ePowerControl PPC GI permet aux agrégateurs de piloter la centrale solaire à distance via l’envoi de consignes d’actif / réactif via Modbus TCP. Exportation des données (durée / granularité configurable) vers plateforme ePowerMonitor ou vers des plates-formes tierces compatibles (FTP push). Exportation des données via clé USB / téléchargement via l’interface locale. ePowerControl PPC DEIE En tant que gestionnaire du réseau français, Enedis (ex-ERDF) impose l’installation d’un Dispositif d’Échange d’Informations d’Exploitation ( ) en France métropolitaine et dans les Zones non interconnectées (ZNI) pour la communication entre le poste de conduite et de surveillance des opérateurs et les centrales solaires à injections.

SCADA Contrôle & analyse sur site Les centrales solaires sont confrontées à de nombreux défis que ce soit en terme de maintenance, ou de performances. Les centrales reliées au réseau sont généralement composées de centaines d’appareils tels que des onduleurs, des compteurs et des stations météorologiques qui sont surveillés simultanément et éparpillés sur de larges zones. Ces équipements génèrent une énorme quantité de données qui peut se révéler difficile à traiter lorsqu’il s’agit de prendre rapidement les meilleures décisions pour la gestion de la centrale. Le système SCADA d’Elum Energy vous permettra de mieux comprendre la signification des données reçues en communiquant ces informations rapidement, avec clarté et efficacité. Contactez-nous pour savoir comment nous pouvons vous aider dans vos projets. Elum SCADA (disponible uniquement avec ePowerControl PPC) offre : Le centre SCADA permet de gérer, sur site, l’exploitation technique des centrales photovoltaïques. Il permet la visualisation en temps réel de toutes les valeurs mesurées localement. En cas de panne ou de dysfonctionnement, vous pouvez réagir rapidement et efficacement grâce aux analyses de haute précision, les diagrammes de flux de puissance et le système de gestion des alarmes. Le système dispose d’interfaces pour tous les équipements compatibles Modbus installés sur le site, tels que les onduleurs, les compteurs, les stations météorologiques, les unités de surveillance des chaînes, les relais SEPAM, etc. Dans le centre SCADA, vous pouvez modifier les variables de lecture sur ces appareils et recevoir immédiatement un retour sur l’état du matériel. Synoptique à une seule ligne, affichant les principaux indicateurs clés de performance de la centrale avec la configuration des jeux de barres, l’état des équipements et les alarmes de la centrale. Entièrement autonome, connexion internet non nécessaire. ePowerControl SCADA alerte l’opérateur en cas d’alarme lié à un équipement ou une installation. Le journal des alarmes est affiché et stocké localement. Collecte et stockage local sécurisé de toutes les données + alarmes des équipements connectés sur le site pendant plus de 100 jours. Les données peuvent être collectées via des compteurs, des onduleurs solaires, des stations MV, des contrôleurs de groupes électrogènes, des capteurs deep L (irradiance/température…) et des E/S. L’interface SCADA permet l’édition de points de consigne de registres inscriptibles accessibles depuis l’équipement (puissance active/réactive, modes de régulation…). L’édition de tous les registres Modbus accessibles en écriture de l’équipement peut se faire localement via l’écran tactile. sur site Une surveillance hors ligne en temps réel : SLD synoptique, affichant les principaux KPI de la centrale et l’état des équipements. Alarmes hors ligne : Aperçu des alarmes en direct Visualisation sur écran tactile : (disponible uniquement avec ePowerControl PPC) Le système SCADA d’Elum est accessible via un écran tactile de 15′ situé sur la porte avant de l’armoire du contrôleur. Le centre SCADA permet de gérer, sur site, l’exploitation technique des centrales photovoltaïques. Il permet la visualisation en temps réel de toutes les valeurs mesurées localement. En cas de panne ou de dysfonctionnement, vous pouvez réagir rapidement et efficacement grâce aux analyses de haute précision, les diagrammes de flux de puissance et le système de gestion des alarmes. L’interface SCADA permet l’édition de points de consigne de registres inscriptibles accessibles depuis l’équipement (puissance active/réactive, modes de régulation…). L’édition de tous les registres Modbus accessibles en écriture de l’équipement peut se faire localement via l’écran tactile.

Nos Produits En savoir plus sur l'utilisation de nos produits ePowerControl ES Supervision‌ ‌à‌ ‌distance‌ ‌des‌ ‌sites‌ ‌télécom‌s Contrôleur pour Microgrids Contrôleur pour système de stockage d'énergie

Ajout d’une capacité solaire à un site poor grid ou off-grid Les bâtiments industriels et commerciaux (C&I) situés dans des géographies avec une connexion réseau faible (poor-grid impliquant des coupures de courant régulières) ou inexistante ont besoin d’un approvisionnement fiable d’énergie pour assurer la continuité de leur opérations. Pour cela ils intègrent généralement des générateurs diesel pour leur approvisionnement en électricité que ce soit en complément du réseau (backup) ou en alimentation primaire (prime) Lorsqu’une capacité de production solaire est ajoutée afin de réduire la consommation de carburant sans ajout de batterie de stockage, la puissance de sortie des onduleurs PV doit être contrôlée afin de permettre un fonctionnement optimal avec des groupes électrogènes tout en évitant le reversement de puissance du solaire vers les groupes électrogènes. ePowerControl SD/HFS est un contrôleur connecté aux onduleurs solaires (RS485/TCP) aux générateurs diesel (soit directement au contrôleur du groupe électrogène soit via des compteurs), au réseau et à la charge du site (via des compteurs) qui monitore et contrôle automatiquement la puissance de sortie des onduleurs PV en fonction des profils de consommation et de production en fonction des contraintes des groupes électrogènes. Le contrôleur permet donc une production solaire en mode ilot assurant la sécurité énergétique du site pour des taux de pénétration importants (jusqu’à 60%) à travers la gestion de la charge minimale du groupe électrogène. Le contrôleur SD/HFS est compatible avec l’ensemble des onduleurs communiquant en Modbus sur le marché. ePowerControl SD/HFS assure la gestion de la charge minimale du groupe électrogène par écrêtage de l’onduleur PV Contrôleur pour centrales PV Diesel Contrôleur hybride solaire et diesel

Bornes de recharge solaires pour véhicules électriques solaires pour véhicules électriques Les bâtiments industriels et commerciaux (C&I) souhaitent aujourd’hui bénéficier d’une énergie solaire avec la possibilité d’intégrer des stations de recharge de véhicule électrique dans leurs emplacements de parking. Lorsqu’une capacité de production solaire + borne de recharge est ajoutée, plusieurs enjeux sont essentiels : Un système de monitoring et pilotage est donc essentiel pour réaliser les services liés à la borne. ePowerLog DL et les solutions ePowerControl ZE /PPC sont les solutions de monitoring et de contrôle d’Elum Energy qui se connectent aux onduleurs solaires (RS485/TCP) , au réseau et à la charge du site (via des compteurs) et aux bornes de recharge (TCP/RS485). Ces solutions monitorent et contrôlent automatiquement la puissance de sortie des onduleurs PV en fonction des contraintes de régulation d’injection du pays. Ces solutions sont compatibles avec l’ensemble des onduleurs communiquant en Modbus sur le marché. ePowerControl PPC V2G communique avec une API envoyée par EDF pour contrôler la borne Monitoring Détection d’anomalie à l’échelle d’un portefeuille de borne de recharge en autoconsommation Application de smart charging : contrôle de la vitesse de chargement de la borne en fonction de l’état de charge des batteries V2G : contrôle en charge et décharge de la borne en fonction des consignes reçues

Autoconsommation solaire connectée réseau Les bâtiments industriels et commerciaux (C&I) situés dans des géographies avec une connexion réseau de bonne qualité souhaitent aujourd’hui bénéficier d’une énergie solaire pour réduire leurs coûts d’approvisionnement énergétique. Lorsqu’une capacité de production solaire est ajoutée, plusieurs enjeux sont essentiels pour le suivi et la maintenance du site : Un système de monitoring et pilotage est donc essentiel pour maximiser le rendement d’une centrale solaire en opération et se conformer aux législations d’injection solaire locales ePowerLog DL et les solutions ePowerControl ZE et ePowerControl PPC DEIE sont les solutions de monitoring et de contrôle d’Elum Energy qui se connectent aux onduleurs solaires (RS485/TCP), au réseau et à la charge du site (via des compteurs). Ces solutions surveillent et contrôlent automatiquement la puissance de sortie des onduleurs PV en fonction des contraintes de régulation d’injection du pays. Ces solutions sont compatibles avec l’ensemble des onduleurs communiquant en Modbus sur le marché. Menu de configuration eConf simple et intuitif permettant la configuration et mise en route du contrôleur en quelques heures Les solutions ePowerControl sont également des dataloggers permettant la remontée de données ePowerControl PPC communique avec le boitier DEIE fourni par EDF pour contrôler les relais ePowerControl ZE assure la limitation d’injection sur le réseau national en cas de surproduction solaire Contrôleur Zéro Export solaire connectée réseau Détection d’anomalie à l’échelle d’un portefeuille de sites en autoconsommation Interdiction d’injection du surplus solaire vers le réseau (régulation présente dans plusieurs géographies) Interfaçage avec boitier DEIE vis à vis d’EDF (France et DOM) ePowerLog DL et les solutions ePowerControl ZE et PPC DEIE sont les solutions de monitoring et de contrôle d’Elum Energy qui se connectent aux onduleurs solaires (RS485/TCP), au réseau et à la charge du site (via des compteurs).

Sous-comptage énergétique pour des sites industriels Sous-comptage énergétique pour des sites industriels Pour les bâtiments industriels, la mesure de la consommation de l’énergie est un indicateur à suivre afin de maîtriser les coûts et suivre la productivité. L’enjeu pour un responsable de maintenance industrielle est d’avoir une visibilité détaillée de la consommation d’énergie du site par poste, machine ou ligne de production pour effectuer des actions de maintenance préventive, mesurer la consommation d’énergie avec une faible granularité et anticiper des pénalités (dépassement de puissance ou facteur de puissance bas). L’accès à des données relevées à la main peu fiables conduit à une difficulté à identifier la source d’un problème à l’échelle de la machine et dans le temps. ePowerLog DL usine est un datalogger permettant la remontée des données énergétiques au niveau des postes de transformation (TGBT) primaires et secondaires. Les données concernent les données électriques mais également des compteurs gaz et air comprimé. Cette remontée de données est affichée sur la plateforme de monitoring ePowerMonitor permettant d’afficher les données de production, consommation réseau, consommation des différents équipements qui permettent d’avoir un outil adapté à la ISO 50001 pour la maîtrise de la consommation énergétique mais également de mettre en place des actions d’efficacité énergétique. Remontée des données énergétiques de différentes natures (électricité, gaz, air comprimé) ePowerMonitor permet de se conformer au standard de la maitrise de l’énergie dans le cadre de la mise en place d’une certification ISO 5001 ePowerMonitor permet de réduire la consommation énergétique en détectant des inefficiences de consommation ePowerMonitor fournit un aperçu en temps réel de la consommation énergétique par machine ainsi qu’une gestion des alarmes personnalisée pour des sites industriels

stockage pour des Utility Power Plants De nombreuses villes ou des complexes industriels miniers sont isolés du réseau national d’électricité. Ces entités sont généralement alimentées par des centrales thermiques (groupes électrogènes, gaz naturel ou HFO) avec un prix de l’électricité pouvant varier grandement en fonction des cours pétroliers ou de la logistique pour l’acheminement du carburant. Dans le but de réduire leur coût d’approvisionnement énergétique, les fournisseurs d’énergies ou les complexes industriels souhaitent donc ajouter un système solaire+stockage aux centrales thermiques existantes. Ainsi l’ajout d’un ESS permet : Selon les contraintes du client ou du régulateur, les solutions ESS peuvent avoir des fonctions de lissage ou de support réseau, d’où l’utilité d’un contrôleur adapté aux spécifications client. Le contrôleur PPC permet également de définir une réserve tournante pour le groupe électrogène, une gestion de la puissance active réactive ainsi que de fixer les paramètres pour une régulation de fréquence adaptée au grid code local. Le contrôleur permet donc une production solaire en mode grid-connected ou iloté assurant la sécurité énergétique du site pour des taux de pénétration importants (jusqu’à 60%) à travers la gestion de la charge minimale du groupe électrogène. Le contrôleur PPC est compatible avec l’ensemble des onduleurs communiquant en Modbus sur le marché. Compatibilité étendue avec les principaux fournisseurs d’onduleurs sur le marché Le contrôleur PPC permet de s’adapter parfaitement à des demandes spécifiques du client final ePowerControl PPC fournit une gestion de l’injection réseau en fonction de la législation spécifique du pays (limitation d’injection ou net metering, adaptation au grid code local) d’augmenter le taux de pénétration solaire de lisser la courbe de production solaire sur le réseau réguler la tension et la fréquence sur le réseau suivant le grid code local

Centrale solaire connectée au réseau Les centrales solaire photovoltaïque devraient dominer la production décentralisée d’électricité dans les prochaines années grâce à leurs avantageuses économies d’échelle. Les centrales solaires PV à grande échelle offrent l’avantage d’une électricité à prix fixe pendant les pics de consommation, lorsque l’électricité produite à partir de sources d’énergie fossiles est la plus chère. Elles peuvent également être associées à un système de stockage d’énergie pour gérer l’augmentation de la demande d’énergie en soirée, assurer une source d’énergie de secours et renforcer la fiabilité et la résilience du réseau. Les propriétaires de ferme solaires ont besoin de solutions de contrôle avancées pour répondre aux multiples normes de conformité opérationnelle et d’interconnexion dans un environnement particulièrement contraignant. De plus, la taille et la complexité du projet, et le fait que l’électricité soit vendue en gros à des acheteurs de services publics, apportent de nouveaux obstacles qui rendent encore plus important le partenariat avec un expert du secteur. Elum Energy fournit ePowerControl PPC-Grid tied; Une solution personnalisable capable de répondre aux exigences du code du réseau local, aux contraintes techniques de l’IPP et du client final pour l’exploitation et la maintenance du site pendant les 25 ans du contrat PPA. Pour savoir comment ePowerControl PPC peut apporter plus de polyvalence à votre projet, contactez-nous. L’ePowerControl PPC-Grid tied d’Elum est un contrôleur de centrale solaire à grande échelle qui est accompagné d’un système de supervision (ePowerMonitor à distance et/ou ePowerControl SCADA local) conçu pour les centrales solaires à grande échelle. C’est une solution entièrement personnalisée, adaptée aux exigences des services publics de distribution d’électricité et aux contraintes spécifiques des projets. Le PPC-Grid tied d’Elum Energy permet : ePowerControl PPC contrôle la centrale solaire en fonction des exigences de l’exploitant du réseau. ePowerControl PPC applique les instructions du gestionnaire de réseau/de l’agrégateur et communique à tout moment l’état de la centrale. ePowerControl PPC Grid-Tied permet la gestion des demandes de découplage/autorisation de couplage/télémétrie des consignes P/Q. Adaptation aux exigences d’aménagement et de contrôle spécifiques au projet. Conformité avec le code de réseau du pays tout en maximisant la production d’électricité et les revenus de l’usine. Le régulateur ePowerControl PPC réduit la quantité exacte d’énergie solaire afin de maximiser la pénétration du soleil tout en évitant toute pénalité de la part de l’opérateur du réseau. L’interface de configuration utilisateur intégrée d’ePowerControl PPC, accessible via n’importe quel navigateur web local (LAN), permet de configurer la connectivité de la centrale et l’intégration des équipements. Une stratégie de contrôle personnalisée Contrôle de la puissance active/réactive Enregistrement de données (datalogging) Contrôle de la puissance réactive, Q ou PF Contrôle de la puissance apparente Q(V) Contrôle de la tension Contrôle de la fréquence (O/F et U/F) Interopérabilité des systèmes de transport Redondance dynamique Transfert sans interruption, contrôle permanent Maximiser la production et les revenus Fonctionnement continu et connectivité du SCADA

Situation La solution Elum Eléments clés Ajout d’un système de stockage pour microgrids Les solutions de stockage d’énergie (ESS) sous forme de batteries (Lithium/Plomb) apparaissent comme des solutions compétitives pour plusieurs configurations de micro-réseaux sur le marché : Ainsi les solutions ESS peuvent avoir différents avantages à la fois au niveau économique et sur la stabilité de la fourniture. Les solutions de contrôle permettent donc d’adapter la fonction de ces solutions ESS en fonction du besoin du client final. ePowerControl MC est un contrôleur connecté aux onduleurs solaires (RS485/TCP), aux onduleurs batteries (RS485/TCP) aux générateurs diesel (soit directement au contrôleur du groupe électrogène soit via des compteurs), au réseau et à la charge du site (via des compteurs) qui monitore et contrôle automatiquement la puissance de sortie des onduleurs PV et batterie en fonction des profils de consommation et de production en fonction des contraintes des groupes électrogènes. Le contrôleur permet donc une production solaire en mode connecté réseau ou iloté assurant la sécurité énergétique du site pour des taux de pénétration importants (jusqu’à 60%) à travers la gestion de la charge minimale du groupe électrogène. Le contrôleur MC est compatible avec l’ensemble des onduleurs communiquant en Modbus sur le marché. Compatibilité étendue avec les principaux fournisseurs d’onduleurs PV et onduleurs batteries sur le marché ePowerControl MC assure la gestion de la charge minimale du groupe électrogène par écrêtage de l’onduleur PV et chargement des onduleurs batterie. Le contrôleur ePowerControl MC permet de maximiser le retour sur investissement des solutions PV+ESS selon la configuration électrique ePowerControl MC fournit une gestion de l’injection réseau en fonction de la législation spécifique du pays (limitation d’injection ou net metering) La plateforme web ePowerMonitor permet de surveiller à distance l’état et la consommation de l’équipement du site afin d’assurer sa performance et faciliter sa maintenance via une gestion d’alarme personnalisée Contrôleur intelligent & plug-and-play Plateforme de monitoring énergétique Contrôleur adapté aux centrales solaires Configuration ilôtée (Electrification rurale, hôtels isolés, fermes agricoles) : Ici l’ajout d’un ESS permet de stocker le surplus solaire durant la journée réduisant ainsi la consommation de carburant. Également l’ESS peut former le réseau dans certains cas ce qui permet de limiter l’utilisation du groupe électrogène au cours de la journée Configuration connecté réseau (Bâtiment industriel et commerciaux) : Ici l’ajout d’un ESS permet de réaliser des applications d’écrêtage (peak-shaving) ou de déplacement d’achat d’énergie (load-shifting) permettant de réaliser des économies selon les tarifications locales Configuration connecté à un réseau de mauvaise qualité (Bâtiment industriel et commercial) : Ici l’ajout d’un ESS a le même comportement pour un application connecté réseau ou ilôté selon l’état du réseau

Supervision à distance des sites telecoms Le SLA (Service Level Agreement) des tours de télécommunication détermine le niveau de contraintes et les pénalités appliquées lorsqu’un fournisseur de services ne respecte pas les paramètres de continuité de service convenus dans les termes de l’accord. Le défi d’un gestionnaire de site de télécommunications consiste à collecter rapidement des informations sur un portefeuille très hétérogène d’équipements installés et sur la configuration électrique du site afin de mener des actions de maintenance et de détecter les vols (batterie et carburant) et l’efficacité énergétique de ses tours. L’accès à des données peu fiables et parfois même incohérentes entraîne des visites multiples et très coûteuses sur l’ensemble du portefeuille. ePowerLog DL télécom est un datalogger permettant la remontée des données sur les différents équipements présents sur la tour télécom (Redresseurs, Climatisations, Groupe électrogènes, MPPT Solaire, Réseau). Cette remontée de données est affichée sur la plateforme de monitoring ePowerMonitor permettant d’afficher les données de production, consommation réseau, consommation équipements télécoms et climatisation qui permettent d’actionner des actions d’efficacité énergétique sur la tour (réglage de température de consigne, suivi de la consommation de carburant sur le site). ePowerMonitor, l’outil de monitoring fourni par Elum permet la remontée des alarmes matériel mais également des alarmes paramétrables par l’utilisateur. Compatibilité étendue avec l’ensemble des redresseurs sur le marché et l’ensemble des contrôleurs de groupe Menu de configuration eConf intuitif et simple permettant la configuration et la mise en route du datalogger en quelques heures ePowerMonitor RMS permet à l’opérateur de détecter rapidement des vols de carburant via le système d’alarme et de notification ePowerMonitor RMS permet à l’opérateur de réduire la consommation énergétique en détectant des inefficiences de consommation (Redresseur ou climatisation mal réglés) ePowerMonitor RMS fournit un aperçu en temps réel de la performance du portefeuille ainsi qu’une gestion des alarmes personnalisée ePowerLog DL Datalogger Universel

Gilytics Information Security External Code 1. Purpose 2. Scope 3. General guidelines 4. Intellectual property 5. Exchange of information 6. Appropriate use of resources 7. User responsibilities The purpose of this document is to establish the information security policy framework for Gilytics’ provider organisations accessing our information, information systems or resources, in order to protect their confidentiality, integrity and availability, when no other contractual agreement addresses these matters. To this end, supplier organisations are responsible for informing their employees, and subcontractors providing services to GILYTICS, about this framework. All activities carried out for GILYTICS by supplier organisations accessing the company’s information, information systems or resources. General guidelines are applicable to any provider organisation, regardless of the type of service provided. Specific guidelines are applicable only to those provider organisations whose services match the type indicated in each section. 3.1. Service provision Supplier organisations may only perform for GILYTICS the activities covered under the corresponding service contract. The provider organisation shall periodically provide GILYTICS with the list of persons, profiles, functions and responsibilities associated with the service provided, and shall promptly inform GILYTICS of any change (registration, cancellation, substitution or change of functions or responsibilities) that may occur in this list. In accordance with the contract clauses for the provision of services, all external persons performing work for GILYTICS must comply with the safety standards described in this document. In case of non-compliance with these obligations, GILYTICS reserves the right to veto the person who has committed the infraction, as well as to adopt sanctioning measures. The provider organisation shall ensure that its personnel have the appropriate training to perform the service. Any exchange of information between GILYTICS and the provider organisation shall be understood to take place within the framework established by the service contract, so that such information may not be used outside this framework or for other purposes. Generically, assets affected by this framework include: 3.2. Confidentiality of information External persons who have access to GILYTICS information should consider that such information is, by default, protected information. Only information to which access has been obtained through the means of public dissemination of information provided for this purpose by GILYTICS may be considered as unprotected information. The disclosure, modification, destruction or misuse of information, whatever its medium, shall be prevented. Maximum confidentiality shall be maintained indefinitely and no protected information shall be released to the outside world unless duly authorised. The number of paper documents containing protected information shall be minimised and they shall be kept in a secure place out of reach of third parties. In the event that, for reasons related to the work for Gilytics, an employee of the provider organisation comes into possession of protected information in any type of support, it must be understood that such possession is temporary, with an obligation of secrecy and without conferring any right of possession, ownership or copy of said information. Likewise, the employee must return the aforementioned media immediately upon completion of the work for Gilytics. All these obligations shall continue after the termination of the provider activities for GILYTICS. Failure to comply with these obligations may constitute an offence of disclosure of secrets. In order to ensure the security of personal data, staff of the provider organisation shall observe the following rules of conduct in addition to the above considerations: Compliance with legal restrictions on the use of material protected by copyright law shall be ensured. The use of unlicensed software on GILYTICS information systems is strictly prohibited. Likewise, the use, reproduction, transfer, transformation or public communication of any type of work or invention by GILYTICS protected by intellectual property is prohibited without due written authorisation. GILYTICS shall only authorise the use of material produced by itself, or material authorised or supplied to it by its owner, in accordance with the agreed terms and conditions and the provisions of the regulations in force. No person providing services to GILYTICS shall conceal or manipulate his or her identity when dealing with the company, or claim to represent GILYTICS to third parties. The distribution of information, whether in electronic or physical format, will be carried out by means of the resources determined in the service provision contract for such purpose and for the exclusive purpose of facilitating the functions associated with such contract. GILYTICS reserves, depending on the identified risk, the implementation of control, registration and audit measures on these dissemination resources. In relation to the exchange of information within the framework of the service provision contract, the following activities within the GILYTICS information systems shall be considered as unauthorised: The provider organisation undertakes to periodically inform GILYTICS of the assets (see 3.1) with which it provides the service. The provider organisation undertakes to use the resources made available for the provision of the service in accordance with the conditions for which they were designed and implemented. The resources that GILYTICS makes available to external parties, regardless of their type (IT, data, software, networks, communication systems, etc.), are available exclusively to fulfil the obligations and purpose of the operation for which they were provided. GILYTICS reserves the right to implement control and audit mechanisms to verify the appropriate use of these resources. All equipment of the supplier organisation connected to the GILYTICS production network shall be of controlled and protected. Any file introduced in the GILYTICS network or in any equipment connected to it through automated media, Internet, electronic mail or any other means, must comply with the requirements established in these rules and, in particular, those referring to intellectual property, personal data protection and malware control. All assets shall be returned to GILYTICS without undue delay after the end of the contract. It is expressly prohibited: Service provider organisations shall ensure that all persons performing work for GILYTICS respect the following principles: Anyone with access to protected information should follow the following guidelines regarding password management: Anyone with access to protected information should adhere to at least the following clean desk rules, in order to protect paper documents, computer media and portable storage devices and to reduce the risks of unauthorised access, loss and damage to information, both during and outside normal working hours: 3.7. User equipment Service provider organisations shall ensure that all user personal computer equipment used to access protected information complies with the following standards: Particular care shall be taken to ensure the security of all user mobile equipment containing or otherwise accessible to protected information: Specific guidelines Scope of application All supplying organisations shall comply, in addition to the general rules, with the specific rules set out in this section that apply to them in each case, depending on the characteristics of the service provided to GILYTICS. The types of service envisaged are as follows. Level of access to GILYTICS systems: Depending on the level of access to GILYTICS information systems, three cases are distinguished: Depending on each of the three categories into which each service falls, the provider organisation must comply, in addition to the general safety standards, with the specific standards set out in the sections indicated in the following table: 4.2. Selection of persons The provider organisation shall verify the professional background of the persons assigned to the service, guaranteeing GILYTICS that they have not been sanctioned in the past for professional malpractice nor have they been involved in incidents related to the confidentiality of the information processed that have led to any type of sanction. The provider organisation shall guarantee GILYTICS the possibility of immediate removal from the persons assigned to the service of any person in relation to whom GILYTICS wishes to exercise the right of veto, in accordance with the conditions set out in section 3.1. 4.3. Security audit The supplier organisation shall allow GILYTICS to carry out the requested safety audits, cooperate with the audit team and provide all evidence and records requested. The scope and depth of each audit will be expressly established by GILYTICS in each case. The audits shall be carried out according to a schedule to be agreed in each case with the service provider organisation. GILYTICS reserves the right to conduct additional extraordinary audits, provided that there are specific grounds for doing so. 4.4. Reporting of incidents When you detect any information security incident, you must notify GILYTICS immediately via the e-mail address security@gilytics.com. Any user may contact the aforementioned mailbox to report any events, suggestions, vulnerabilities, etc. that may be related to information security and the guidelines contemplated in these rules. Any incident that affects or may affect the security of personal data (e.g. loss of lists and/or computer media, suspicion of improper use of authorised access by other persons, recovery of data from backup copies, etc.) must be notified through the aforementioned mailbox. This mailbox centralises the collection, analysis and management of the incidents received. If access to the mailbox is not available, the communication channels established within the service itself should be used, so that the GILYTICS interlocutor is the one to communicate the security incident. 4.5. Physical security The venue shall be locked and shall have some form of access control system. There shall be some form of visitor control, at least in areas of public access and/or loading and unloading. The site shall at least have adequate fire detection and fire extinguishing systems and shall be constructed in such a way as to be sufficiently resistant to flooding. If any backup is maintained, the systems hosting and/or processing such information shall be located in a specially protected area, which includes at least the following security measures: 4.6. Asset management The provider organisation shall have an up-to-date asset register in which the assets used for the provision of the service can be identified. All assets used for the provision of the service shall have a responsible person who ensures that such assets incorporate the security measures established by the provider organisation, which shall be at least those specified in this regulation. The Provider Organisation shall notify GILYTICS of the decommissioning of assets used for the provision of the service. If the asset contains other GILYTICS property (hardware, software or other assets), it must be handed over to GILYTICS prior to the decommissioning in order for GILYTICS to proceed with the removal of the assets owned by GILYTICS. Whenever an asset has contained protected information, the provider organisation shall carry out asset retirement by ensuring the secure disposal of such information, either by applying secure deletion functions or by physically destroying the asset, so that the information contained therein cannot be recovered. 4.7. Security architecture Whenever the service provider organisation carries out development and/or testing of applications for GILYTICS or with protected information, the environments in which such activities are carried out shall be isolated from each other and also isolated from production environments in which protected information is housed or processed. All access to information systems hosting or processing protected information shall be protected at least by a firewall limiting the ability to connect to them. Information systems housing or processing particularly sensitive information shall be isolated from other information systems. 4.8. System security Information systems that host or process protected information shall record the most significant events surrounding their operation. These activity logs shall be covered by the provider organisation’s backup policy. The clocks of the provider organisation’s systems that process or host protected information shall be synchronised with each other and with the official time. The service provider organisation shall ensure that the capacity of information systems storing or processing protected information is adequately managed, avoiding potential downtime or malfunctioning of such systems due to resource saturation. Information systems hosting or processing protected information shall be adequately protected against malicious software by applying the following precautions: The provider organisation shall establish a backup policy to ensure the safeguarding of any data or information relevant to the service provided, on a weekly basis. Whenever e-mail is used in connection with the service provided, the provider organisation shall respect the following premises: Whenever GILYTICS e-mail is used for the provision of the service, at least the following principles must be respected: Access to information systems housing or processing protected information must always be authenticated, at least by using a person identifier and an associated password. Information systems that house or process protected information shall have access control systems that limit access to such information to service personnel only. Access sessions to information systems hosting or processing protected information shall be automatically blocked after a certain period of inactivity of the users. Whenever using software provided by GILYTICS, the following rules must be observed: 4.9. Network security Networks transporting protected information must be adequately managed and controlled, ensuring that there are no accesses or connections not appropriately secured by the provider organisation. The services provided on these networks should be limited as much as possible. Networks allowing access to GILYTICS ICT infrastructure shall be appropriately secured, and the following requirements shall be met: Teleworking, considered as access to the corporate network from outside, is regulated by the application of the following regulations: In addition, whenever the Internet access provided by GILYTICS is used, the following rules must be observed: 4.10. Traceability of system use Authorized access and activities in the provider’s systems shall be logged and these logs shall be retained in accordance with the Organisation’s backup regulations. Errors and failures in systems activity shall be analysed and remedial action shall be taken. 4.11. Identity and access control and management All users with access to an information system shall have a single access authorisation consisting of a user ID and password. Users shall be responsible for all activity related to the use of their authorised access. Users shall not use any authorised access of another user, even if they have the owner’s authorisation. Under no circumstances should users disclose their identifier and/or password to any other person, nor should they keep it in writing in plain view or within the reach of third parties. The minimum length of the password must be 6 characters and must not contain the name, surname or identifier of the user in it. It must be changed every 45 days and must not repeat at least the previous 8 passwords. They must also be complex and difficult to guess, and therefore consist of a combination of at least 3 of these 4 options in the first 8 characters: uppercase, lowercase, numbers and special characters. It is recommended to use the following guidelines for password selection: The provider organisation shall ensure that it is regularly ascertained that only duly authorised persons have access to the protected information. In those cases where GILYTICS information systems are also accessed, the following regulations must also be considered: If a user suspects that his/her authorised access (user ID and password) is being used by another person, he/she should change his/her password and notify the incident to the e-mail address security@gilytics.com. 4.12. Change management All changes to the ICT infrastructure must be controlled and authorised, ensuring that no uncontrolled components are integrated. All new components introduced into the provider organisation’s ICT infrastructure used for the provision of the service should be verified to ensure that they function properly and fulfil the purposes for which they were introduced. 4.13. Technical change management All changes that are made shall be carried out in accordance with a formally established and documented procedure, which ensures that the appropriate steps for making the change are followed. The change management procedure shall ensure that changes to the ICT infrastructure are minimised and limited to those that are strictly necessary. All changes should be tested before deployment in the production environment to ensure that there are no unintended or undesirable side effects on the operation and security of the ICT infrastructure. The provider organisations shall scan and mitigate technical vulnerabilities in the infrastructures used for the provision of the service, informing GILYTICS of all those associated with critical components. 4.14. Security in development The entire outsourced software development process will be controlled and supervised by GILYTICS. Identification, authentication, access control, auditing and integrity mechanisms will be incorporated throughout the software design, development, deployment and operation lifecycle. The software specifications shall expressly contain the safety requirements to be covered in each case. The software to be developed should incorporate input validations to verify that the data is correct and appropriate and to prevent the introduction of executable code. The internal processes developed by the applications shall incorporate all necessary validations to ensure that no corruption of information occurs. Whenever necessary, authentication and integrity control functions should be incorporated in the communications between the different components of the applications. The output information provided by applications should be limited, ensuring that only relevant and necessary information is provided. Access to the source code of the applications shall be limited to service personnel. In the test environment, real data shall only be used if they have been appropriately decoupled or if it can be ensured that the security measures applied are equivalent to those in the production environment. During the testing of the applications, it will be verified that there are no uncontrolled information gaps, and that only the intended information is provided through the established channels. Only software that has been expressly approved shall be transferred to the production environment. In relation to web services, the recommendations of the Owasp Top 10 will be considered. 4.15. Contingency management The service shall have a plan that allows for its provision even in case of contingencies. The above plan shall be developed based on the events capable of causing service disruptions and their likelihood of occurrence. The provider organisation shall be able to demonstrate the feasibility of the existing contingency plan. 4.16. Monitoring and control In order to ensure the correct use of the aforementioned resources, GILYTICS will check the compliance with this framework through the formal and technical mechanisms deemed appropriate, either periodically or when it is convenient for specific security or service reasons. Dec 5, 2022

This Best Practice Webinar, organised with Renewable Grid Initiative, will focus on how their GIS Decision Support System ‘Pathfinder’ can optimise energy infrastructure planning and design. You can watch the webinar here:

FAQs What data is needed to use Pathfinder? How are parameters set? Is raster or vector data used? Is Pathfinder compatible with other GIS solutions we are already using? Is Pathfinder only available on the cloud? Can overhead and earth cable routes be analyzed? Can offshore routes be analyzed? Can Pathfinder be used for Renewables? How does Pathfinder automatically generate routes and can I validate results? How can you customize settings for my country? Can you help us with data management? Can other kinds of non-spatial data be used? How is Pathfinder different from other tools? How can we try Pathfinder? How much does a license cost? How do I contact support? GIS data from any source can be used including but not limited to ESRI gdb or PostGIS formats. Cadastral data for land parcels and properties, and DXF data can also be added. Your own data from surveys can also be added. Users set parameters based on local requirements and are given training on how to prepare data for analysis. Both raster and vector data can be used. Yes, data can be imported and exported from other tools and analyzed in Pathfinder, so you do not need to change existing processes. Pathfinder can be used on the cloud for optimal speed and on premise if required. Both overhead and earth cable routes can be analyzed and combined in one project. Offshore routes can be analyzed depending on data availability. Pathfinder can help to identify where to locate substations and routes to connect projects to the grid. Pathfinder uses user input and spatial data to quickly automate route generation based on user input and can be used to validate results. You set the resistance values for your country based on local regulatory requirements. Gilytics can help you to review data to make it easy to import and analyze data. Drone and satellite images can be used. Pathfinder is a project management tool using spatial data that is often used later in the project process then similar GIS tools that are more focused on spatial data management. You can request a free trial account to test Pathfinder or request a live demo or explore a pilot with us testing Pathfinder on your own data. We offer a range of packages depending on your needs and the number of projects and users at a range of price points. Users can use our support chat to address any issues they have. Looking for more insights and what Pathfinder platform can do?

How it works How to test As part of ESRI Starupt program, Gilytics now offers a direct Add-in for Esri Arc GIS (Desktop and Pro). Esri product users can now directly benefit from the power of Pathfinder routing and siting algorithms while using familiar Arc GIS environment. Use your Esri data to setup projects and scenarios. Easily apply planning rules and generate options which provide you with shortest route or environmentally best area to site your infrastructure. To do this you select layers (vector/raster) and define buffers and resistance values. Pathfinder algorithms generate land suitability (resistance) maps, corridors, and paths which you can analyze using your GIS data and ArcGIS geoprocesses. See a short video on youtube. You can use the Esri Add-in for various applications like routing of linear infrastructure for overhead lines, earth cable, rail, streets etc. or you can find the best sites for substations, solar parks or other areas. Pathfinder offers you algorithms and parameters to optimize for different goals like residential impact, cost, environment etc. so you can quickly find an optimal solution for your project. You can read more here. The Pathfinder Esri Add-in delivers you the following benefits: Download the Add-in here. There is a version for Arc GIS Desktop and a version for Arc GIS Pro. Then you need a Pathfinder license to get full access, so get in contact with Gilytics Team so we can help you get started. Posted in Blog, News

Post navigation How geodata can help speed up planning of linear infrastructure projects We are thrilled to announce that Gilytics has achieved certification for ISO 9001:2015 and ISO/IEC 27001:2013, both globally recognized and respected international standards for quality management and information security. ISO 9001, a quality management standard, demonstrates our commitment to delivering high-quality products and services that meet or exceed our customers’ expectations, while continuously improving our processes and procedures. On the other hand, ISO 27001 certification verifies that we have implemented a comprehensive information security management system, including policies, procedures, and controls to protect our customers’ and partners’ sensitive information. Gilytics takes great pride in achieving these certifications as a testament to our commitment to providing exceptional customer service and maintaining the highest standards of quality and security. We would like to take this opportunity to thank all of our employees, customers, and partners for their support in helping us achieve these certifications. We look forward to continuing to provide the highest level of quality and security in everything we do. Posted in News

Video Tutorials PATHFINDER TUTORIALS WEBINARS OTHER VIDEOS Create a project and add data Setup simulation scenarios Calculating optimal routes Comparing and reporting alternative routes 3D visualization and editing of routes Pathfinder Webinar Swissgrid TSO Switzerland Pathfinder Demo Augmented Reality Get answers to your questions to get started using Pathfinder. Pathfinder Tutorial 1: In this tutorial video you will learn how to create projects and add data to the projects in Pathfinder. You will learn how to set up the scenarios to simulate resistance maps and later calculate optimal routes. After setting up our routing scenario constraints, we can calculate the corridor map, showing the areas closer to optimal routes, and compute these paths using different options. After calculating the optimal paths for multiple scenarios, we can compare them quantitatively to support the decision-making process, and print a report with the results. In addition to comparing route alternatives quantitatively, we can also display them in 3D with other reference objects, and adjust manually the pylon location. Webinar Learn from Swissgrid about how Pathfinder helps them to optimize planning. In this Best Practice Webinar RGI, Gilytics, and Swissgrid introduced Pathfinder, showing how the tool can adapt to different challenges within the infrastructure planning and design stages, as well as how it can be implemented for TSOs to promote nature-positive energy systems. Learn how Pathfinder works in a short introductory video. See how AR can be used to show where a future overhead line project will appear using a tablet or a mobile phone.

Case Studies SBB Swiss Rail Operator A+S Umwelt Energie Germany Axpo DSO Switzerland See how our customers are saving time and money and supporting growth by optimizing routing and siting. The Swiss railway operator SBB operates over 3,200 km of rail network, which is 100% electrified. SBB also operates 8 hydroelectric power plants and its own 134 kV high-voltage network for safe power transmission across Switzerland. SBB is a central part of the Swiss society and economy and stands for punctuality and reliability. SBB uses Pathfinder, for transmission line planning and substation siting in early planning phases and to support decision-making in strategic grid planning. The solution helps to present risks and options in a comprehensible manner and evaluate alternatives in a standardized and transparent way. A+S Umwelt Energie, based in Berlin and Brandenburg, offers IT-related services in the planning and approval of linear infrastructure projects. A+S works for customers in the energy market, such as TenneT TSO in Germany, 50 Hertz Transmission and Arcadis. The team, with its many years of experience, uses Pathfinder in project work in the cooperation between environmental planners, route planners and clients. TenneT is a leading European electricity transmission system operator with their main activities in the Netherlands and Germany, managing over 23,900 kilometers of high-voltage connections with 42 million users. TenneT works with Gilytics to help them to achieve their large-scale grid expansion plan faster. Pathfinder Platform is used to plan for underground cable and overhead line projects. Corridors and routes can be quickly identified and compared using a simple workflow, making the engineering work required faster and easier allowing fast decision making and comparing different scenarios in days instead of months. Axpo is a Swiss electrictiy Distribution System Operator and the largest producer of renewable energy in Switzerland. To speed up projects they use Pathfinder Platform for overhead line and underground cable route design comparisons. The tool helps them to evaluate different options based on costs, lengths and technical parameters. The tool minimizes land parcels crossed and helps to identify more easily routes in environmentally sensitive areas with difficult topography. More on Axpos Offering on their Homepage. Swissgrid is the Swiss electrictiy Transmission System Operator managing 6,700 km of grid in mountainous and densely populated areas with interconnection throughout Europe. Pathfinder Platform provides decision support during the feasibility and pre-design phase to plan, discuss, and define corridor and route options. The results are used in the permitting and public stakeholder engagement process. More on swissgrid.ch (in German)

In particular, for users who do not program themselves, the software represents an enormous benefit, as the nocode environment is easy to handle. Results can be visualized, documented and easily exported. This way, team capacities can be distributed much more flexibly, and a lot of time can be saved. FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS Practical Questions Technical Questions Commercial Questions Leave your question How quickly do Geyser Batteries charge? Do Geyser Batteries heat up a lot? Are they hazardous in this respect? Can Geyser Batteries be completely discharged? How often can you charge Geyser batteries? What is the size and the form factor of a Geyser battery? What is a typical ESR of Geyser Batteries? What is specific energy demonstrated by your products? When can we use Geyser Batteries in our products? What is the price for Geyser Batteries? Looking for some answers? Below is some of the most common questions we’ve been asked. Did not find what you’re looking for? We're here to help. Geyser Batteries charge to full state in minutes, in some cases in seconds. They are the fastest-charging batteries on the market. No. Geyser batteries do not heat up a lot and are not hazardous. First of all we use water as a base for electrolytes, so Geyser Batteries are inherently fire safe and do not show thermal runaway as other technologies do. Secondly, heating up during normal operation is quite limited compared to other battery technologies due to a large effective cross section (current flow) in the cells. Thermal management in general is rather simple in Geyser Batteries. The reason for both advantages is the bipolar cell design. Yes. Geyser Batteries can be safely discharged down to zero volts and it does not affect the lifetime of the device. Geyser batteries can be charged and discharged hundreds of times per day and up to 1 million times over lifetime. The bipolar cell design generally allows for high flexibility of the shape and form of the battery. Our cells are essentially a stack of very thin sheets of electrode and separator materials and the cells can also be stacked on top of each other, getting connected in series and forming a cellblock with desired voltage level. This means we can reach rather high voltages in very confined spaces. To give you an example: a 48V cellblock can be built a little over 1cm thick. Thanks to bipolar technology our cells and cellblocks have a large effective cross section and therefore show a very low ESR - in the range of few mOhm at module level. Specific energy of Geyser Batteries may vary from single digit to dozens of Wh/kg on module level. Our Electrochemical system allows for fine tuning of power vs. energy - depending on the requirements of the target application. Last year we successfully automated the cell assembly process and are working on implementing the technology in a pilot line assembly line. Currently we produce our batteries in small batches for proof of concept (POC) projects and lab testing. But in 2023 we will ramp up the production capacity to supply large pilot installations, customer design-ins and small series. So if you already have an application in mind, we probably better start talking about your requirements now. In the future we will also offer licenses to produce our batteries locally around the globe. With the installation of our pilot production line we will be price competitive with our major competitors (Supercapacitors) from day one - even at small volumes. We expect to expand our cost advantage up to 50% in 5 years. The reasons for the cost advantage is the use of common materials and a robust and efficient production process (no drying process, no clean rooms, low energy consumption) with low CAPEX. Submit

Design Engineer, production equipment Mikkeli What is this job about? Who we are? What do we offer? What next? 1.8.2023 We are recruiting new superheroes in our R&D team! If SolidEdge and Autodesk Inventor sound like something you use on a daily basis, and at the same time you have passion for new technologies and innovation, then we are waiting just for you! By joining Geyser Batteries as Design Engineer, Production Equipment, you will be contributing to the design and development of unique equipment for manufacturing of innovative batteries, developed and patented by Geyser Batteries. While we expect you to have 3-5 years of relevant experience in designing production equipment as well as possession of hands-on skills (such as welding, electrical assembly, milling), we also appreciate your desire to approach new challenges with a fresh perspective. Knowledge and experience of developing technical documentation (at least 2 years) and using SolidEdge, SolidWorks, Autodesk Inventor (including use of calculation modules) are a prerequisite to succeed in this role. Excellent English written and oral communication skills are expected. In this position, your daily responsibilities could include: Developing and fine tuning the design of automatic assembly equipment; Contributing to the development of design of the production line for manufacturing of a new class of high-power batteries; Preparing technical documentation in accordance with industry standards. If you see that this could be your day, you love solving technical challenges and have a passion for sustainability, be sure to apply. While we appreciate your university degree in a field of engineering, we are even more interested in you and your ideas and skills. Geyser Batteries develops and produces a new class of high-power and high-cycling batteries, ideally suited for fast energy storage, especially in the power grid sector. We are financed by the leading Finnish industrial investors and supported by Business Finland. Our technology is set to be a game changer in the transition to 100% renewables-based power grid by providing fast-storage batteries with a minimal cost per charge, lowest in class greenhouse gas emissions, maximum safety and ease of recycling. Having started at the end of 2018, we are now working for and with major customers and partners, like Ørsted, Shell and Fraunhofer, and are active in various research&innovation organisations at the European level. We pay at market rates. Our growth expectations are remarkable and based on your personal growth and success in the position, you may expect your role to evolve accordingly based on your interests and skillset. Long-term financial and organizational compensation can be expected in this start-up environment. As a company, we are always curious, eager to learn from each other, and foster new ideas to grow as a team towards the new heights. Our team is diverse, energetic, and supportive, and we come to work every day because we see how big of an impact we are going to make on the global transition to net-zero. Does this sound like the perfect position for you? Send your brief CV to jobs@geyserbatteries.com asap and share with us why you think this role is good for you. If you have questions regarding the job and want to have a chat first, do not hesitate to contact us using the same email above. Geyser Batteries - R&D Center Insinöörinkatu 5 50150 Mikkeli Finland . jobs@geyserbatteries.com

MAKE ELECTRIFICATION SUSTAINABLE e-Mobility Hybrid industrial Grid stabilization & Renewables Electrified future. The global economy is in the middle of an energy transition. Our aim is to support this transition by offering sustainable and cost-efficient high-power energy storage that has minimal CO2 footprint - during the entire lifetime of the product. Geyser Batteries outperform supercapacitors by all parameters and compete strongly against li-ion systems optimized for high power, making our power batteries the best solution for a variety of transportation applications, including cold cranking, mild-hybrid powertrains, start-stop systems, opportunity-charged electric buses, etc. From cranes to stackers, forklifts to generators, Geyser Batteries present an unrivalled combination of power, reliability and safety for electric and hybrid electric machinery. Our power batteries remain powerful and functional in any environment – with the ability to work in a wide temperature range. Our technology guarantees long life and absolute safety. The use of Geyser Batteries is hassle-free, as they are easy to manage thermally and require hardly any maintenance, thereby slashing your system’s operational costs. Geyser Batteries offer energy storage capabilities that rival lead-acid batteries while providing millions of charge-recharge cycles at high power levels, providing longer-lasting energy than supercapacitors and ultra-capacitors. This makes our batteries unique for a wide range of power grid applications, such as grid stabilization, with operating timescales ranging from seconds to days. Geyser Batteries outperform supercapacitors by all parameters and compete strongly against li-ion systems optimized for high power, making our power batteries the best solution for a variety of transportation applications, including cold cranking, mild-hybrid powertrains, start-stop systems, opportunity-charged electric buses, etc.

POWERING THE TOUGHEST USE CASES Green manufacturing Safe technology Sustainable energy storage Download white paper By downloading our white paper, you agree the terms and conditions of our Privacy Notice. Geyser Batteries deliver power where other energy storage solutions fail: sustaining over a million of deep-discharge cycles at ultra-high power in extreme ambient conditions. Based on widely available chemical materials and using water as a solvent for electrolytes, our power batteries pose no fire/explosion hazard. Aqueous electrolytes also result to less energy-extensive manufacturing process, which is a major difference to manufacturing supercapacitors and Li-ion batteries based on organic electrolytes. Therefore, our products are uniquely sustainable. Furthermore, with their long life and over a million charge-discharge cycle capability, Geyser Batteries produce less waste over time. Geyser Batteries are designed to outperform some of the best high-power energy storage solutions available today. Backed by decades of research, development and technological advancement, our products combine the energy storage capability of batteries with the durability and ultra high power performance of supercapacitors in a single electrochemical system. Our power batteries push the boundaries of electrochemical energy storage capabilities in terms of the number of charge-discharge cycles, operational temperature range, and they are recharged almost instantly every time. They require no maintenance and are easy to keep cool, thanks to their planar internal structure. The bipolar design used in Geyser Batteries results in the largest possible cross section for internal current across the whole device. Bipolar design guarantees also uniform current density on electrodes. These unique features contribute to low and uniform heat generation which is easy to control. For a customer this means a long and healthy battery life with no maintenance required along the way. POWER GRID Enabling Renewables and Electrification The rapid electrification in all areas of human life is increasing the demand for electrical power in all Power Grids - from large grids to micro grids and islands. Immense cost improvements for renewable energy is driving an exponential growth of the renewable share in the energy mix of most countries. And this is negatively impacting availability and stability of the Power Grid - ranging from frequency fluctuations to black outs. So the transition to a low carbon society is creating challenges for the Power Grid on the supply and the demand side at the same time. This is putting energy storage at the heart of a stable Renewable Power Grid. And the requirements for storage duration vary from milliseconds up to months. Geyser Batteries are capable of being recharged in seconds to minutes and maintain continuous high power at discharge - ideally covering storage durations of milliseconds to minutes. Geyser Batteries consist to a large extent of recycled or sustainable materials, are manufactured very energy efficient, provide a long product lifetime and can easily be recycled after use - reducing the carbon footprint throughout the life cycle to a minimum. ​Geyser Batteries require no maintenance while being charged and discharged up to a million times over lifetime - reducing the cost for energy stored to a minimum. Geyser Batteries can be discharged to 0V, do not contain toxic or flammable solvents and can be safely shipped and disassembled - reducing the health and safety risk throughout the life cycle to a minimum Geyser Battery technology can be used on both sides of the meter to increase Power Grid robustness while saving cost and opening up new revenue streams for our customers. rapid electrification renewable energy stable Renewable Power Grid milliseconds to minutes recycled or sustainable materials carbon footprint cost for energy stored health and safety Geyser Battery

TRANSPORTATION Sustainable Power Batteries for Life Geyser Batteries offer the transportation industry a sustainable solution to help OEMs to meet the toughest CO2 emissions standards. The unique combination of ultra high specific power (kWs per kg), durability (over one million cycles) and good energy density of over 10 Wh/kg achieved even at overly high discharge rate, makes Geyser Batteries an ideal solution for a wide range of applications. These include low-voltage mild-hybrids, high-voltage full-hybrid powertrains, cold-cranking power sources for large ICEs of diesel trucks and traction batteries for opportunity charged, fully electric buses, amongst others. Our power battery products can run through several million deep charge-discharge cycles and are highly versatile. They can operate even in the most demanding environmental conditions; for example, Geyser Batteries continue to perform in temperatures as low as -40°C. By using Geyser Batteries you can make sure that your vehicle will start easier, even in extremely cold weather, and continue to perform even during peak loads. Fire hazard is minimized using aqueous electrolyte - Geyser Batteries can guarantee unprecedented safety for your electrical systems. Heavy Machinery Check out our industrial power battery solutions. Power Batteries for Life

Manage your energy Introducing Enfyo® The heart of your control system Project typology Customers and partners Design and engineering Digital transformation of the control system Simplify your asset management Isolated installations Individually connected Collective Connected Visit us at Contact Privacy summary Control and monitoring solutions for smart grids, with integration of renewable energies and battery storage. Prediction Renewable energies Storage View product > see on google We optimise your storage and generation facility using intelligent data analysis and forecasting techniques to minimise the cost of energy. Through our distributed control architecture on the device and in the cloud, we provide you with transparent and flexible control of all electrical grid elements. We facilitate the integration of all distributed resources and consumption measurement points, so that you are independent of the technology provided by different manufacturers. Your energy router. Using advanced signal processing techniques, digital models and predictive systems, it optimises the power flow of electrical grid assets. We have developed electronic equipment and a set of software tools that facilitate the rapid design of electricity distribution electrical grid control systems, integrating the use of renewable energies and storage systems, facilitating energy optimisation, taking into account safety, efficiency and profitability criteria. Through vertical integration of asset monitoring and control solutions (generation and storage systems), Enfasys' technology allows to incorporate a comprehensive knowledge of the entire system and to adapt to the rules of an electricity market that is immersed in the biggest revolution of the last 100 years. The monitoring, management and data analysis system for your distributed resources. Learn more about Enfasys Cloud It is the in the Edge control system for real-time management of all your assets. Learn more about Enfyo Enfasys Cloud integrates subscription-based services for weather and demand forecasting. Learn more about Enfasys Cloud Enfasys enables the management of distributed generation systems using the IEEE 1547 standard, simplifying access to them and integration with electrical grid management systems. Learn more about Enfyo Enfasys specialises in the control and management of storage systems for grid integration. This know-how enables optimisation of the most critical resource in hybrid plants or collective self-consumption installations. Learn more about energy storage Aligned with the strategies and technological trends for the transformation of the European energy system, taking into account ecological and economic efficiency criteria, promoting the transition towards more intelligent, flexible and sustainable energy supply systems. A stand-alone installation is one that does not have an electricity connection to the distribution electrical grid. In such a way that the consumer is self-sufficient in energy production and does not depend on any commercialisation company. In this type of installation, if the generation is 100% renewable, energy storage is necessary to guarantee supply during the hours when this generation is not available. An individual connected installation is one that, in addition to being capable of generating electricity, has an electrical connection to the distribution grid through a retailer, supplying electricity to a single end user. In this type of installation, energy storage is not necessary, as it is connected to the distribution grid as a back-up in the event that generation is not available. It is the end customer who decides on the basis of different criteria (mainly economic) whether the generation will have surpluses and whether these are stored or fed into the distribution grid in exchange for financial compensation. This case is identical to the case of individual connected installations, but as the name itself indicates, the management and supply is now carried out to different users. The approval of Royal Decree 244 of April 2019 enables collective consumption, i.e. it enables several consumers to share the same generating plant. This opens up a large number of savings and business possibilities, but at the same time entails greater complexity in the control and management of the installations, as it is necessary to dynamically distribute the energy between users and bill it individually. ENFASYS es una spin-off de la Universidad de Oviedo que tiene el objetivo de convertir la investigación realizada en el grupo LEMUR en un sistema de hardware y un conjunto de librerías de software y aplicaciones orientadas al control y monitorización de redes eléctricas. Devolvemos a la sociedad el conocimiento y resultados de la investigación, generando empleo, dinamizando la economía y mejorando el medio ambiente. Un equipo de profesionales altamente calificados y experimentados, especializados en ingeniería (informática, industrial y electrónica), junto con experiencia en innovación, productos y servicios, y administración y gestión de negocios. Monitorización, Gestión y Análisis desde un único lugar. Acceso a servicios por subscripción para la optimización de los recursos distribuidos. Integración con tu propio sistema de gestión. Accede desde cualquier dispositivo Centralización Subscripción a servicios complementarios. Adaptación Escala la solución de control de los activos de la red hacia la nube mediante nuestra plataforma. La plataforma en la nube Enfasys Cloud permite la gestión de todos los activos e instalaciones desde un único lugar. Accede a los datos de todos los dispositivos en tiempo real, realiza labores de análisis de datos utilizando herramientas visuales y bases de datos de series temporales y toma decisiones en base a herramientas comparativas que te permiten optimizar la operación de todos tus recursos de la red. La optimización de los recursos distribuidos y su integración con la red eléctrica requiere del acceso a servicios online. Esto nos permite proyectar el precio de la energía a futuro, además de contar con herramientas climatológicas que facilitan planificar la gestión de los sistemas de almacenamiento. La plataforma da acceso a dichos servicios y distribuye la información entre los dispositivos Enfyo. La plataforma Enfasys Cloud se integra con tu propio sistema de gestión, de forma que toda la información utilizada para la gestión de los recursos distribuidos esté disponible dónde la necesites. Se proporcionan plugins a los servicios en la nube más conocidos así como desarrollo de conexiones propietarias a medida. Todo ello considerando la seguridad de los datos como la piedra angular del sistema.

Operaciones de forma sencilla y sin sorpresas. Módulo String Banco Soluciones de control para sistemas de almacenamiento de energía. Desarrollamos soluciones de control para sistemas de almacenamiento de energía basados en baterías de Li-ion. La integración en vertical del sistema de control de Enfasys es puntera en el mercado, con un conocimiento exhaustivo tanto del funcionamiento interno como de la operación del mismo. A la hora de integrar un sistema de almacenamiento en red, es necesario un único punto de acceso hacia el exterior que aglutine toda la información del sistema. Utilizando Enfyo como elemento de control, la solución de Enfasys integra las comunicaciones y la coordinación con todos los subsistemas de comunicaciones, el inversor de potencia y el operador del sistema utilizando estándares (IEEE 1547/IEEE 2030.5) para facilitar la operación remota del recurso distribuido. A nivel de módulo, Enfasys tiene una dilatada experiencia en el desarrollo de BMS. Se proporcionan soluciones basadas en ecualización pasiva/activa para módulos con diferentes configuraciones de celdas serie/paralela. Se incluyen alternativas para funcionamiento standalone o integradas con sistemas de control a nivel de string y banco. Existen opciones con diferentes buses de comunicaciones (CAN, IsoSPI, Modbus-TCP). Se incluye el desarrollo de algoritmos de SoC, SoH, SoF y RUL. A nivel de string, la solución de Enfasys permite la integración de módulos conectados en serie. El número máximo de módulos viene determinado por el bus de comunicaciones seleccionado y arquitecturas hasta 24 elementos en serie han sido validadas. El sistema de control integra tanto el manejo de medidas y protecciones a nivel de string como la implementación de algoritmia cuando se usa conjuntamente con BMS esclavas. En soluciones de alta energía/potencia, el paralelizado de strings es la arquitectura seleccionada, formando bancos de energía. La propuesta de ENFASYS es escalable y permite el control de dichos elementos y la integración con los diferentes sistemas de control de nivel inferior (Módulo y String) y el superior (Sistema).
